comment.realname: Llyfrgell Genedlaethol Cymru  / The National Library of Wales
comment.author: 37199428@N06
comment._content: Children often helped out with the salvage effort. In November 1939 these members of the 1st Newtown Scout troop used a horse and cart to collect waste paper from around the town.

comment.author: 29137109@N00
comment._content:
I like how the smallest and youngest is left to hold the horse.
Looking at this, it appears to have been photographed on High Street, outside The Buck Inn and Boots, facing the Market Hall.

comment.author: 32013832@N03
comment._content: What grabs my attention the most is the impish little lad in the front, with his stance, hand on the stack on the cart, and that sweet little look on his face. Priceless! This is a wonderful photograph.
